Title: [L07] Precision loss in fixed point library
Content:
The [`FixedPoint` library](https://github.com/compound-finance/open-oracle/blob/d0a0d0301bff08457d9dfc5861080d3124d079cd/contracts/Uniswap/UniswapLib.sol#L6) implements two functions for handling fixed point binary numbers represented in [UQ112x112 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q_(number_format)). The [`decode112with18` function](https://github.com/compound-finance/open-oracle/blob/d0a0d0301bff08457d9dfc5861080d3124d079cd/contracts/Uniswap/UniswapLib.sol#L21) intends to decode a formatted number into a regular uint256 type with 18 decimals in precision. Since simply scaling up the UQ112x112 number could result in an overflow, the function [uses an approximation](https://github.com/compound-finance/open-oracle/blob/d0a0d0301bff08457d9dfc5861080d3124d079cd/contracts/Uniswap/UniswapLib.sol#L27) to safely scale the number. Therefore some precision is lost in the resulting number. As an example, the division of two equal numbers does not yield `1000000000000000000` but `1000000000000002239` instead.


Consider adding thorough unit tests for the `FixedPoint` library to ensure it behaves as expected. Moreover, consider documenting any precision loss in the library, even if it does not directly affect the calculations in the Open Price Feed. Finally, consider updating the `5192296858534816` denominator to `5192296858534827`, which represents [a closer approximation](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=2+**+%28112+-+log2%281e18%29%29) and should therefore reduce the precision error.
